title: 10 to compete for one medical seat this year
body: Around 10 candidates are expected to compete for each seat at medical and dental colleges this year, with the admission test scheduled for Friday. The MBBS and BDS admission tests for the 2025â€“26 session will be held simultaneously at 10:00am across 49 venues nationwide. Candidates must enter the exam hall between 8:00am and 9:30am. Entry will close at 9:30am, the health ministry said in a press release yesterday. Applicants must carry a transparent bag containing a colour admit card, a transparent black-ink ballpoint pen, and their HSC/equivalent admit card or registration card. No other bags, mobile phones, calculators, electronic devices, watches, or similar items are allowed inside the centre. This year's written test will feature 100 MCQ questions based on the HSC syllabus, each worth 1 mark. The pass mark is 40. The exam duration has been increased to 1 hour and 15 minutes, and 0.25 marks will be deducted for each wrong answer. A total of 122,632 candidates have applied for 13,051 MBBS and BDS seats. Of them, 49,028 are male, and 73,604 are female. Government medical and dental colleges have 5,645 seats -- 5,100 for MBBS and 545 for BDS. Private institutions offer 7,406 seats, including 6,001 for MBBS and 1,405 for BDS.
